section.title: The indefinite article: a or an
section.sectiontitle: We use a/an for a singular noun with jobs and to mean one.
section.text1a: I'm an artist and my wife's a musician.
section.sectiontitle2: We use a with these phrases: a lot of and a long time.
section.text4a: We often wait a long time for a bus.

section.title: The definite article: the
section.sectiontitle: We use the with times of day: morning, evening, afternoon but not with night.
section.text1a: I get up at seven in the morning.
section.text2a: We go to bed at 11 o'clock at night.
section.sectiontitle2: We use the with these phrases: the city centre and on the right/left.
section.text3a: Do you work in the city centre?

section.title: The zero article (no article)
section.sectiontitle: We do not use a, an or the with towns and cities and most countries.

section.title: The zero article (no article)
section.sectiontitle: We do not use articles with by and transport or with times and days.
section.text2a: I finish work at four o'clock on Fridays.
section.sectiontitle2: We do not use a, an or the with these phrases: go to work/home, at work/home and some/most people.
section.text4a: Most people watch TV in the evening.
